timeline.bodyText:
@rsynek This TransformerFactory instance is not used to create a transformer. A fresh instance without these attributes is created on line 100 so this seems to have no effect.
Furthermore, is this even needed? This method is only used to write our own classes to XML. The attack seems to be applicable to XML reading only.
timeline.author: yurloc

replies.bodyText: Thanks for spotting this; we truly don't process any external XML, nor XSL templates that could be forged. It's likely a false-positive issue.
replies.author: rsynek

replies.bodyText: On the other hand there is the read() method that is used to read solver config XML. So that might be used for this type of attack.
replies.author: yurloc

replies.bodyText:
According to:
https://cheatsheetseries.owasp.org/cheatsheets/XML_External_Entity_Prevention_Cheat_Sheet.html
Unmarshaller should be secured by default since one particular Java 8 update.
I plan to look into this more closely now in connection with validation by XSD (which is another potential source of the XXE attack).
replies.author: rsynek

replies.bodyText:
Sounds good. Thanks for the update!
I think this doesn't need a unit test. We don't have the bandwidth to create and maintain tests for bugs in 3rd party code that have already been fixed.
My only suggestion is to remove the security configuration that is not in fact needed.
